text:
Pivotal role of early and sustained infarct vessel patency in patients with acute myocardial infarction.
 Thrombolytic therapy in acute myocardial infarction unequivocally has improved short- and long-term mortality.
 The fundamental goal of therapy for evolving myocardial infarction is early and sustained infarct vessel recanalization.
 The mechanisms linking an open artery with improved long-term survival and other clinical outcomes are presented with use of data from extensive clinical trials.
